segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the message type, its function, and the reference number for the response.
DTM, A segment identifying the relevant dates and times associated with the response. The segment must be specified at least once to specify the processing date of the response message.
ERC, A segment identifying the type of application errors within the message to which CASRES is a response.
LOC, A segment identifying the jurisdiction and court or tribunal locations associated with the response message.
RFF, A segment to specify a particular reference associated with the response when required, e.g. reference number for a legal case.
MOA, A segment identifying a monetary amount involved in the dispute.

FTX, A segment for free text information in coded or clear form, to give further clarification to the response message, e.g. the type of complaint, the nature of complaint. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying the particulars of a party to a dispute.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the name and address of a party.
SEQ, A segment to provide for the allocation of a sequence number (referenced in the GIR of Segment group 2) to a party involved in a dispute.
FTX, A segment for free text information in coded or clear form, to give further clarification when required of a party, e.g. 'trading as' and other legal descriptions.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the particular details applicable to a court or tribunal order.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to provide relevant descriptive information relating to a court or tribunal order (certificate).

GIR, A segment to identify a group of parties (via the sequence numbers allocated in Segment group 1) related to an order, e.g. all the parties that the order is on behalf of, or all the parties to which the order applies.
PYT, A segment identifying the terms of payment, e.g. by instalment.
DTM, A segment identifying the relevant date, time or period associated with the order, e.g. date order made, instalment periods.
MOA, A segment identifying a monetary amount involved in the order.
FTX, A segment for free text information in coded or clear form, to give further clarification when required to a court or tribunal order.
